results.title: Of bards and beggars
results.brief_description: An interesting documentary about the Raikas of Rajasthan, India, and their 400 year old religious tradition of Jagraan, a prayer ritual to a folk deity known as Pabuji. Pabuji is a virtuous being who looks after his people and their animals especially during times of sickness but also in health. Raikas believe that cattle and camels are their wealth and if an animal is sick, a prayer will be made to Pabuji. The Jagraan consists of an all night epic recitation by a folk musician and singer known as a Bhopa who recounts the legend and deeds of Pajubi to an audience made up mostly of livestock herders. Although a religious event it is also seen to be entertainment for the community. Sadly though, the practice of Jagraan is under threat as village herders are being pushed out by agribusiness and limestone mining. These industries have taken their land which has led to a decrease in grazing land for their herds. At the same time there is no government support and construction sites are appearing all over rural Rajasthan. The old traditional ways of Bhopas with their musical instruments and costume dress is also disappearing due to the diminishing rural population and modern technology in the form of radio and television. More and more they are performing in the hospitality and tourist industry. Contains personal narratives by Raika herders and excerpts from the recitation. Partially funded by the Australia India Council.

results.title: Oedipus Rex. No. 4. The Recovery of Oedipus
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, Massachusetts Council for the Humanities and Michael Roemer
results.brief_description: Demonstrates how Greek tragedy considers the status of man as being somewhere between God and beast, always looking for his rightful place. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Oedipus Rex. No. 3. Man and god
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, Massachusetts Council for the Humanities and John Barnes
results.brief_description: Explains that one philosophical message of “Oedipus Rex” is that man is subordinate to God. Shows how this theme is reinforced when Oedipus, representing the worldly liberal thought infusing Greek civilisation, is beaten by the gods. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, Massachusetts Council for the Humanities and John Barnes

results.title: Oedipus Rex. No. 2. The character of Oedipus
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, Massachusetts Council for the Humanities and John Barnes
results.brief_description: Analyses the character and actions of Oedipus in terms of Aristotle’s theory of the “fatal flaw” in all tragic characters. Presents important scenes from the drama to show character development. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Oedipus Rex. No. 1. The age of Sophocles
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, Massachusetts Council for the Humanities and John Barnes
results.brief_description: An interpretation of Sophocles Oedipus Rex, with historical background of the Ancient Greeks, and a discussion of its relevance to our times, including the nature and meaning of man. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Oedipus Rex = Edipo Re
results.brief_description: A son’s loving obsession with his mother turns to patricide and incest in this intricate exploration of what Freud has termed “the Oedipus complex.” Pasolini’s powerful adaptation of Sophocles’ play is a unique voyage of psychological discovery which blends the director’s personal history with the timeless themes of mythology. Filmed amidst the atmospheric setting of the Moroccan desert and modern Bologna, “Oedipus Rex” is a startling visual achievement, boasting an extraordinary central performance by Franco Citti as the tortured Oedipus.

results.title: Odyssey of the mind
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Quantum”.
This segment from “Quantum” looks at the international competition for secondary schools called ‘Odyssey of the mind’, designed to encourage and foster creative thinking in young people. The segment focuses on students in Newcastle, N.S.W., and the way the competition is used to teach students the secrets of creative thinking.

results.title: Ode to a shoebox
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Narada Lawson
results.brief_description: The outside walls of the housing commission flats were as grey as a winter’s day and as cold as charity. But inside was a warm world of fun, love an adventure. This is an account of living in public housing in Melbourne.

results.title: Oddities of the law. No. 1. Laws of the road
results.brief_description: A light-hearted look at several quirks in local road law. Short scenes dramatise the consequences of such laws, providing ample humour with: the New Hampshire ruling that when tow cars arrive at an intersection, neither can go until the other has passed; the New Mexico statute that forbids cars with “inharmonious” horns; the California law that forbids bicycles from over-taking firetrucks; and the Milwaukee by-law that states that no vehicle can park in one place for more than two hours unless it is attached to a horse.
